headline.main: A Pitch to Obama on Food and Farming

docs.abstract: Foodies lobby Obama on his choice of Agriculture Secretary.
docs.lead_paragraph: The fact that a Secretary of Agriculture has yet to be named has some chefs, farmers and animal welfare advocates wondering whether food and farming have been shoved to the Obama D team.
docs.snippet: Foodies lobby Obama on his choice of Agriculture Secretary.

headline.main: Bad News for Couch Potatoes (and their Parents)

docs.abstract: Parents have long suspected they aren't doing their offspring any good by letting them vegetate in front of the television set, or even a computer terminal. And many parents do what they can to intervene. ("Turn off the boob tube!" is still a rallying cry in many homes.) Now, in what may qualify as some [...]

headline.main: Industry vs. Reform, School Lunches and Toxic Incinerators

docs.lead_paragraph: Health news from around the Web.
docs.snippet: Health news from around the Web.

docs.abstract: How many total calories would you say are in an Applebee's chicken salad, two crackers and a 20-ounce regular Pepsi with 25 percent ice? (Pierre Chandon/Insead) Those "Trans Fat-Free" crackers pictured at left seem to have magical calorie-reducing properties on the whole meal, as I found in an experiment described in my Findings column. Foods [...]
docs.lead_paragraph: Those "Trans Fat-Free" crackers pictured at left seem to have magical calorie-reducing properties on the whole meal, as I found in an experiment described in my Findings column. Foods or restaurants with virtuous reputations seem to be imbued with a "health halo" that makes us underestimate calories, and I'd like to hear Lab readers' thoughts on how to deal with this effect.

headline.print_headline: Health Halo Can Hide The Calories
headline.main: Health Halo Can Hide the Calories

docs.lead_paragraph: Have Americans been seduced into overeating by the so-called health halo associated with certain foods and restaurants?
docs.snippet: Have Americans been seduced into overeating by the so-called health halo associated with certain foods and restaurants?

headline.seo: Report Ties Children’s Use of Media to Their Health
headline.print_headline: Report Ties Children’s Use Of Media to Their Health
headline.main: Report Ties Children’s Use of Media to Their Health

docs.lead_paragraph: A review of 173 studies found that more time with television, films, video games, magazines, music and the Internet was linked to rises in childhood obesity, tobacco use and sexual behavior.
docs.snippet: A review of 173 studies found that more time with television, films, video games, magazines, music and the Internet was linked to rises in childhood obesity, tobacco use and sexual behavior.
